sources.title: The British Royal Family (banned documentary)
sources.description: Royal Family (also known as The Royal Family) is a British television documentary about the family of Queen Elizabeth II. It originally aired on BBC 1 and ITV in June 1969. The film attracted over 38 million viewers in the United Kingdom, and was sold around the world and seen by an estimated 350 million people. The Queen later had the documentary banned; it has not been shown on British TV since 1977. Source:  Royal Family (film) See also: 1969: A Record of the Year  (Prince Charles' Investiture as Prince of Wales is covered on Side 1 of the album) Through Childhood to the Throne - A Panorama in Sound How the Princess and her Fiancé descend from Queen Victoria Luncheon Menu and Programme honouring Their Royal Highnesses The Princess Elizabeth and The Duke of Edinburgh Royal Wedding of Princess Elizabeth and Philip Mountbatten BBC TV Coronation of Queen Elizabeth II Coronation Supplement Elizabeth and Philip The Second Elizabeth Royal Destiny Life of a Queen Royal Children The Queen's Suite State Funeral of HM Queen Elizabeth II
